name: Craft wooden pickaxe
goal: Craft a wooden pickaxe from planks and sticks using a crafting table
notes: The wooden pickaxe is the first mining tool. It can mine stone and coal ore but NOT iron ore. You need at least a stone pickaxe to mine iron. Any plank type works (oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark_oak, mangrove, cherry, pale_oak, bamboo, crimson, warped). Requires a crafting table.

steps.title: Obtain planks
steps.details: You need 3 planks of any wood type. If you have logs, craft them into planks (1 log = 4 planks). If you have Blocks of Bamboo, craft those into bamboo planks (1 Block of Bamboo = 2 planks). See the 'Craft planks' recipe for all wood type details.
checks: Have at least 3 planks in inventory

steps.title: Craft sticks
steps.details: You need 2 sticks. Craft sticks from planks: place 2 planks vertically in crafting grid to get 4 sticks. Alternatively, 2 bamboo items vertically also yields 1 stick. Recipe: 2 planks -> 4 sticks.
checks: Have at least 2 sticks in inventory

steps.title: Craft the wooden pickaxe
steps.details: Use a crafting table. Place 3 planks across the top row, then 1 stick in center-middle and 1 stick in center-bottom. Recipe: { "recipe": "wooden_pickaxe", "count": 1 }. The wooden pickaxe has 59 durability and mines stone-tier blocks.
checks: Crafting table is accessible or placed nearby
